posts.body:
>>a2e8f453-9234-43d4-9350-d53dd1a2e592
The problem is not bandwidth or storage space. Almost anyone can afford hundreds of gigs, so in that respect we're good for weeks, and the bandwidth for sharing a single image from one PC to another is theoretically less than a single second even for less than stellar connections.
No, the main problem is just that Zeronet has brain damage.
Even when disabling Tor my  average speed is like 80KB/s for both upload and download for some reason even when though I have a connection that can sustain about 5 MB/s upload when using regular torrents.

>>e7fe788d-13b4-47fe-8d95-24ec14c42b15
Yes. You have to increase the total allowed size in the files tab of the home page.

>>212c9b32-e055-4385-925a-7e1c05b94533
Is this the Todd Rod everybody keeps talking about?

>>c37aff9f-dd14-4833-a281-10afc0c42139
No idea. Stuff like this is why I'm gonna stick to Windows for a week or two before trying to run the board on Linux. At least then I'll know what to look for to get things to work.

>>c37aff9f-dd14-4833-a281-10afc0c42139
In any case there are multiple files related to trackers in the data folder, I'd begin looking there.

>>7f9c51e2-b09a-4452-819a-96055f3cdbff
>the owner of the site can still delete shit if he wants (whatever updates he makes have priority in the 'hive mind')
Any way to patch that in Zeronet? I already set all the js and static files to read only so he can't mess with that.
What we need now is a truly censorless  platform and then everybody can subscribe to the mod streams they prefer applying their preferred moderation policies.

>>f5cc959d-e8ab-454b-9b3e-51c1dbad8d65
can't see the image

>>a88311ed-e7b0-4609-8161-ad5e777c4994
>Why can't we sage on this board?
You're free to submit a pull request to Millchan :^)

posts.subject: Store and forward networks
posts.body:
How resistant is this board to latency?
Could updates be sent on tapes and other physical media like Fidonet and Usenet used to be sometimes?

>>235e2d51-818d-4a1c-8218-f3d35a6d90fe
>you can try to setup your computer firewall the way that no one will connect you (so you will not be sending any data to other peers)
Torrents don't work that way.
You can still seed even with only being able to make outgoing connections.
That said, I made some test and clearnet download is just as slow. The bottleneck is somewhere else it seems.

>>3fee89df-18c1-4c84-9a7d-e5c5bad5a248
I'd say only if the amount of working trackers reaches 2 or less. Otherwise leave it alone.
Edit: I think it's a problem only if you're seeding a large amount of content. I have about 8GB so I need it.
>>f89d59f1-2902-4344-8c07-04e1a85ae9a4
You have to go to the configuration page (cog wheel icon).

>>2717743d-2751-4f70-9408-83c8292ee9ae
>dogdging the question
Forth confirmed to be dog slow.
Edit: added a pun

>>7d4dad79-9651-4152-b214-f2dc6f3e8f59
>One group wants you to at least make the effort of posting image graphics
<wanting to slow down the board and make content unavailable from 0 seeders
kike detected

>>ec7e4e70-7bfb-4b67-ac91-d53fb59a9cf9
The larger the board becomes, the lower the probability that any given user has the content you're looking for. I don't know the details of the protocol, but unless the tracker is aware of every post (which would be insane and would cause ever tracker to ban us) as the board grows you'll have to go through more and more users before you find one that has what you're looking for.
Keep in mind this is the largest Zeronet site that has ever existed. The system will probably need a heavy redesign of its peering system to make boards with hundreds of thousands of posts usable at all.

>>48f1c89d-eaa2-42b9-8823-2c669b527540
>hundreds of lines of unauditable code
>yet I'm the glownigger
Cry me a river, FBI. The shills in this thread pretty much confirm the code contains a backdoor or at least 0days.
>>611a988b-df51-436f-82f7-16881eb3d52f
\ZeroNet-win-dist-win64\ZeroNet-win-dist-win64\data\1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D\js\all.js
Some parts of all.js are minified. They're one liners, so you'll have to scroll down for them or simply search for "min.js".
>>aa6d26ce-23ae-4aa7-bbee-76c57acd1887
Yeah, good luck restoring those variable names, retard.
Three shills so far out of 14 comments. Looks like we're onto something.

>>f63c74b1-56dd-430a-a6b3-b99d9ab9b79c
As the code seems to be only for libraries, you could in theory substitute it for the original non-minified library.
But serving the minified files is still pretty shady, because nobody is going to difff all of them  against the standalone libraries for every changed version of the code, and any changes could have plausible deniability for being bug or feature fixes, and in that case we'd have to reverse engineer the minified code to find out what the change did.

>>93a95b43-431f-4679-9db1-3d7c658d0c48
I think I found the issue.
Every time the total site increases by a big amount -say, 200MB- my downloaded data increases by about the same.
So I think the part that's missing is just content that's been posted but has zero seeders now. Making it virtually impossible to reach 100%, ever.
So that's the reason shit's so slow to download. Because basically we already have everything we can get at the moment.

>>c8ee84c5-607f-43cb-bb12-c0854e4bf7d6
I don't know what that is, but it doesn't seem to be the all.js file, at least not all of it. It doesn't even have the non minified ZeroFrame class at the beginning.
In any case, method names are the least of our concerns. JS minifiers have a very hard time obfuscating method names without breaking the code.

>>7a308b72-c065-49ab-a0c4-0b5bb43264d6
Well it shouldn't. Variable names, formatting and comments should be kept intact. I'm sure it's a simple switch in Webpack.

>>651b228b-4fb6-4d02-90e7-3396eb872a58
The video would be better without that wanna be e-celeb commenting every clip.

>>c1e7c9df-1dff-4276-afc2-b87b0035552f
How the fuck did you manage that much?

>>c1e7c9df-1dff-4276-afc2-b87b0035552f
Also post your % for the site.
This, lads, is a supersonic cruise missile

The aspect ratio of the two heads is totally different.

>>56a072b5-21db-4acb-8bf7-8c8768235820
